go_data.justification: VAMP1 encodes a protein involved in vesicle fusion mainly at neuromuscular synapses.
VAMP1 is involved in vesicle fusion mainly at neuromuscular synapses.
Mutations in VAMP1 lead to presynaptic congenital myasthenic syndrome with neurophysiological evidence of presynaptic neuromuscular transmission impairment.
Synaptobrevin1/VAMP1 is involved in Ca2+-triggered neurotransmitter release at the neuromuscular junction.
